item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, March 28, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. We hacked Google's A.I Gemini and leaked its source code (at least some part) (134 points | 27 comments)
2. How Kerala got rich (191 points | 99 comments)
3. Xee: A Modern XPath and XSLT Engine in Rust (165 points | 82 comments)
4. Show HN: Hexi, modern header-only network binary serialisation for C++ hackers (29 points | 7 comments)
5. Decomposing a Factorial into Large Factors (81 points | 15 comments)
6. A cretaceous fly trap? remarkable abdominal modification in a fossil wasp (5 points | discuss)
7. The Biology of a Large Language Model (91 points | 15 comments)
8. Hyperlegibility (16 points | 1 comment)
9. The Real Book (2021) (35 points | 2 comments)
10. Superhyperbola (7 points | 3 comments)
11. How to Write Blog Posts That Developers Read · Refactoring English (188 points | 72 comments)
12. Disk I/O bottlenecks in GitHub Actions (57 points | 37 comments)
13. Getting hit by lightning is good for some tropical trees (102 points | 47 comments)
14. Cross-Platform P2P Wi-Fi: How the EU Killed AWDL (131 points | 71 comments)
15. Architecture Patterns with Python (378 points | 89 comments)
16. SignalBotOne – Notification Webhooks for Signal (7 points | 4 comments)
17. Building Statically Linked Go Executables with CGO and Zig (54 points | 10 comments)
18. MilliForth-6502: The smallest Forth real programming language for 6502 (80 points | 10 comments)
19. Show HN: Cursor IDE now remembers your coding prefs using MCP (55 points | 19 comments)
20. PermitFlow (YC W22) Is Hiring Senior/Staff Engineers in NYC ( | hide)
21. Show HN (20 points | 14 comments)
22. Giant, fungus-like organism may be a completely unknown branch of life (258 points | 111 comments)
23. Things I would have told myself before building an autorouter (334 points | 89 comments)
24. Tracing the thoughts of a large language model (921 points | 317 comments)
25. How to Use Em Dashes (–), En Dashes (–), and Hyphens (-) (560 points | 424 comments)
26. The Biology of B-Movie Monsters (2003) (36 points | 25 comments)
27. I asked police to send me their public surveillance footage of my car (421 points | 319 comments)
28. A note on the USB-to-PS/2 mouse adapter that came with Microsoft mouse devices (334 points | 103 comments)
29. Moiré Than Meets the Eye: Uncovering the Quantum Potential of Phasons (13 points | 1 comment)
30. Japanese scientists create new plastic that dissolves in saltwater overnight (99 points | 57 comments)
